alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:51PM EDT until May 21 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL PISCATAQUIS COUNTY... At 750 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Lobster Lake to 6 miles southeast of Rockwood to 13 miles southeast of Jackman, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Ripogenus, Kokadjo, Northeast Carry, Lobster Lake, Rockwood, Lobster Township, Frenchtown, Beaver Cove, Spencer Bay, Lily Bay, North East Carry and Mount Kineo. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Moosehead Lake, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
